conbody.p: Eucalyptus 3.2 resolves issues listed in the following table.

row.entry: Issue
Description
Make clone timeout for NetApp configurable
3.1.X message binding cache causes upgrade operations to fail.
A sensor resource (instance) can disappear before recording a sensor timestamp, preventing cache expiration.
Usage data reset after instance reboot
Sensor cache can erroneously time out a cache entry
NC: node controller locks up with one thread in libvirt
After launching Windows image (BFEBS and Walrus-backed), eucalyptus-nc process locks up
Shipped eucalyptus.conf describes incorrect default LOGLEVEL
Address state updated outside of any transaction
Restored instances are missing expiry time
reporting: backend logs show sensor data aggregation errors
When log level is changed on java components, it gets picked up only on CLC and is not broadcasted to SC, Walrus
style progress bar for user console
USER-CONSOLE (AFTER MULTI-THREAD FIX) Cannot create security group
New fault for the disabled.lock file is missing variables
IP address field in security group rules validates my input as wrong before I've even entered it.
console - Windows password not showing
console - StopInstance hangs
User Console: User can request 999 IP allocation on the UI, which can flood the CLC.
Recent change in euare policy causing failures when users try to launch instances
Troubleshooting "out of memory" ratios allow values greater than 1
Instance sensor not gathering usage (due to double free in CC marshaling)
After changing cloud.vmstate.instance_subdomain, instances are not able to resolve private instance DNS name
creating new key pair in launch instance wizard does not update selection in summary area automatically
Long key name makes giant dropdown on the launch dialog page
Remove test logging messages (including FATAL, ERROR) from log level change listener
Default bucket limit is too low
created security group with open port ssh via launch wizard but still getting warning that no rules are defined
USER-CONSOLE: When attaching volume to instance, the list of volumes is hard to read due to its transparent background.
volumes fail to attach due to libvirt err
Libvirt attachment failures leave iscsi connection behind
USER-CONSOLE: In the create new security group box, "Add Another Rule" and "Create" buttons do not get lit when IP is typed.
please remove GUI functions that support volume creation at instance launch time (and launch more like this)
USER-CONSOLE: Cannot copy-and-paste the error message when failed to delete security group
USER-CONSOLE: Failed to delete security groups
euca-describe-services --partition doesn't work
Cannot delete some inbound rules when managing rules for security group -- It depends on the order of delete operations.
"out of memory" fault written a large number of times in cloud-fault.log
Copy multipath example into doc dir
Fault message for lack of iscsi module in the kernel is incorrect
Authentication method for User Console does not support full latin char set
when AZ is not specified on run, but existing instances within group are running, clc does not choose AZ with free resources
euca-modify-image-attribute allows invalid userId without error.
euca-describe-image-attribute does not list all permissions
failed to delete security group but doesn't tell me why
cloud-fault.log records wrong time when writing fault messages
unexpected error adding rules to security group
New notifications impl. for multi-ops
Instance address restoration fails for "inactive" address
Having 58 running instances causes the console proxy server to crash
On the instance page, Image IDs should also be hyperlinked to display information on which image is being used by the running instance
Timeout or single threading issue in Tornado: Deleting 100 security groups at once causes the delete call to time-out and kicks user out of the console
When there exists 200+ security group, creating a new security group causes the user to be forced to log off.
Instance restore does not update state for restored public ip
By default, when the button "create volume from snapshot" is selected, the menu should allow user to click the button "create volume" immediately.
Cannot delete a snapshot that is in "failed" state
Change in log level does not execute correctly on C components
Allocating 200+ IPs on a single user crashes the proxy.
IPs in the IP Address table are sorted in a lexical order
When ntpd is not running no fault message is generated in cc-fault.log and cloud-fault.log
cloud-fault log reports the same "Not enough memory" fault many times when actually not running out of memory
Instances not restored when image deregistered/no longer present
Instances not restored when in terminated state
photo should not scroll in easter egg
Modifying log level for clc breaks the cloud
dimension names for disk-based sensors are wrong
When allocating IP addresses, you are allowed to enter a negative number.
Security Group is created even when faulty input was used
Default log level in cc. log and nc.log is DEBUG instead of INFO
launch more like this dialog, advanced section is displaying Select advanced options label multiple times
Instance restore fails to complete DB transaction for some errors
two different "data loading" messages display on landing pages when data is loading
changing security group rules via Manage Rules dialog does not render a success message in the notifications area when I change something and say Save Changes.
Admin UI failed to lookup images for non-admin user when non-public images are present
launch instance wizard security group rules display shows entity instead of being rendered properly
sorting instances by launch time is not working
Signature problem with pre-signed URLs
Unable to delete user volumes and snapshots
NC/VB: blobstore may not clean up after failed downloads
CLC does not assign a public IP, DB inconsistency
Quota limiting against vmtype doesn't work
NC provides false booting report for windows instance due to insufficient cache size
Failing to delete volumes on Dell Equallogic using SAN adapter
Incorrect image name in describe image response
Inconsistence EBS <-> Instance
File names with % embedded fail to upload to walrus.
duplicate public IP for instances in eucalyptus 3.1.0
HashMap never be removed in walrus,cause a Memory overflow problem.
Debian Pre-Depend causes issues in Lucid
L2TP tunnel does not get established in multi-cluster
Eucalyptus repeatedly connects tgtd to non-existent loopback devices.
Order of account/user fields is inconsistent in admin UI
CC registration: cloud-pk.pem is not transferred to remote cluster, and CC shutdown will not tear down network rules
CLC remebers only first allocations of Elastic IPs after restarting CLC.
Cannot detach EBS volume from stopped instance
Reporting counts a walrus object removed when it has its delete marker removed during a PUT operation
Walrus lists object versions in reverse order
CLC always return A response for AAAA or TXT DNS query
CLC has incorrect default encoding
Addrs remain on CC if instances are terminated while service is down
Hitting walrus.storagemaxbucketsizeinmb limit creates orphan files on the WS file system
Binding error when registering image with multiple device mappings
Canned ACLs do not permit access to buckets/keys as expected and invalid canned ACL names are permitted
C-APP Logs rolling does not care for the configured LOGROLLNUMBER value in eucalyptus.conf
euca-bundle-instance terminates existing instance
After using over 127 groups no longer able to launch instances due to no remaining network tags
DescribeInstances api call does not return ip addresses
eucalyptus-cloud binary does not honor --bind-addr argument
VMware Broker requires eucalyptus user to have write access to the /etc/eucalyptus directory
